text: Israel Rescued

On that day, Yahweh will punish with his cruel, great and strong sword Leviathan, \add the\add* fleeing serpent, and Leviathan, \add the\add* twisting serpent, and he will kill the sea monster that \add is\add* in the sea.
On that day:
“A vineyard of beauty! Sing in praise of it!
I, Yahweh, \add am\add* her keeper;
I water it ⸤again and again⸥.\f + \fr 27:3 \ft Literally “by moments” \f*
Lest one afflict \add harm\add* on it,
I guard it night and day;
⸤I have no wrath⸥.\f + \fr 27:4 \ft Literally “There is no wrath for me” \f*
Whatever gives me thorns \add and\add* briers,
I will step forth against in battle.
I will set it on fire altogether.
Or let it grasp at my protection;
let it make peace with me;
peace let it make with me.”
⸤Days are coming⸥,\f + \fr 27:6 \ft Literally “The coming ones” \f* let Jacob take root;
Israel will blossom and send out shoots,
and they will fill \add the\add* face of \add the\add* world \add with\add* fruit.
Does he strike him ⸤as he struck down those who struck him⸥?\f + \fr 27:7 \ft Literally “like the striking of one striking him” \f*
Or is he killed ⸤as those who killed him were killed⸥?\f + \fr 27:7 \ft Literally “like the killing of his killed ones” \f*
By expelling\f + \fr 27:8 \ft Meaning uncertain, derived from the following parallel expression \f* her, by her sending away, you argue with her.
He removed \add them\add* with his strong wind,
in \add the\add* day of \add the\add* east wind.
Therefore by this he will make atonement \add for\add* the guilt of Jacob,
and this \add will be\add* all of \add the\add* fruit \add of\add* the removal of his sin:
⸤when he makes⸥\f + \fr 27:9 \ft Literally “in his setting” \f* all \add the\add* stones of \add the\add* altar like crushed stones of chalk,
no poles of Asherah worship or incense altars will stand.
For \add the\add* fortified city \add is\add* solitary,
a settlement deserted and forsaken, like the wilderness;
\add the\add* calf grazes there,
lies down there and destroys its branches.
⸤When its branches are dry⸥,\f + \fr 27:11 \ft Literally “In her branch being dry” \f* they are broken;
women \add are\add* coming \add and\add* setting light to it.
For it \add is\add* not a people of understanding;
therefore his maker will not have compassion on him,
and his creator will not show him favor.
And this shall happen:

on that day, Yahweh will thresh from the floodwaters of the Euphrates to the wadi\f + \fr 27:12 \ft A seasonal stream that is often dry \f* of Egypt, and \add as for\add* you, you will be gathered one by one, sons of Israel.
And this shall happen:
on that day, a great trumpet will be blown,
and those who were lost in the land of Assyria will come,
and those who were scattered in the land of Egypt,
and they will bow down to Yahweh on the ⸤holy mountain⸥\f + \fr 27:13 \ft Literally “mountain of holiness” \f* at Jerusalem.
